review.title: Convenient to the Orpheum Theater, otherwise so-so
review.reviewText:
The staff is pleasant and helpful. Desk staff even came out to meet me at my car to check ID. (I sent my wife in to register due to my mobility issues, but reservation was in my name.) But we had a 20 minute wait while they checked "availability" of the accessible room I'd reserved. Room was on the 14th floor with admonitions to NOT use the elevators in case of fire. (Logic?)
The room had a tub/shower not easily accessible to me. The faucet in the sink was set so water never got hot. The bed was a standard double. For the rates they charge, I think accommodations could be a little more luxurious. And finally, the Keurig coffers maker for in-room coffee malfunctioned. Would not heat or stay turned on. Won't recommend and do not plan to stay there ever again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is convenient, and the staff is helpful and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Better beds, attention to detail (coffee machine), better understanding of needs of disabled guests. What may minimum ADA rules may not suffice.

review.title: SF week end

Had a great stay. Clean, comfortable, and conveniently located. Checking in and checking out was fast and easy.
review.locationRemarks: Near the train system, which can take you all over town.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Close and convient to shops and food. Can walk and get cab quickly. Walls are very thin. You can hear your neighbor like they are in your room. Our room was very bright in the morning. The curtains didn't block out sun very well.
Good place and services. Good bar and restaurant. I can come back again in the future.

review.title: Nice Hotel Central to all the sights
review.reviewText:
It's hard to choose hotels in big cities that you're not familiar with; you never know what you're going to get. This Holiday Inn is one of the best I've stayed at, with newer facilities, a restaurant, bar, and convenient (albeit pricey) parking. $37 a night to park but that's expected in the big city.

The room was nice with a cool view of San Fran, right in the heart of the Civic Center area. This is pretty centrally located to anywhere you want to go, which was great for my girlfriend and I. The room came with a Keurig coffee (we had a King Bed room) and was very clean. Seemed like it had been renovated recently. Staff was very friendly, check-in was kind of a wait but what can you do? Plus, their vending machines for pop only cost $1.50. When is the last time that happened?

The walls are a bit thin, so if you're offended by late-night/early-morning love-making, maybe get some earplugs or check elsewhere. But it really wasn't bad and we had a really nice stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, nice staff, newer rooms and convenient parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Balcony doors. You have these nice balconies off the rooms but none of the doors open! That would have been really nice. Improve check-in wait.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is central, but close to there is the Civic Center, Union Square and you're not too far from Mission Dist. and even Castro St.!

review.reviewText: It was a clean hotel, but there was no refrigerator. Cleaning staff bothered us more than once. And the beds were hard.

review.title: ...except maid service coming in at 8:30 AM
review.reviewText:
Hotel was fine and th reception services were great. However, I left early in the morning to check out views of the Golden Gate Bridge. 

I did not like coming back to find that the cleaning crew was about to enter my room at only 8:30 AM! I think it's ridiculous to start checking in on guests so early in the morning UNLESS it's confirmed that they've checked out. Whether I was inside sleeping or not, it would've been disruptive to me to have the maids checking in on me. I thought that's what reception was for. 

It wasn't a big deal since I was already awake and they didn't actually enter (I arrived at my door right as they knocked), but that's my ONLY complaint.

review.title: Not impressed at all.
review.reviewText: Overall my experience was one that will also be my last. The staff was ok and I think 98% of them that I saw were Asian and older. They only have 1 restaurant in the hotel and frankly it's terrible and overpriced and horrid hours so make sure you bring your own food. They charge for everything and anything including like almost 20 a day for parking and it'snot really that secure and very small spaces. If you have a truck than I wish you the best of luck getting in and out. The positive about this was its close to where I was supposed to be during my trip made my life easier. The sleeping conditions well bed was horrid and the sheets and stuff they put on there even worse. I ended up going out and buying my own to feel comfortable and eventually slept on the floor one night due to how rock hard the bed felt. I definitely felt I didn't receive the holiday Inn experience I normally do when staying at one of their properties.

Must solve a problem with the current in the rooms: The air in the corridor (cold) slides under the front door, this becomes a problem at night. I used towels to close the air gap.

Getting to Market Street is simple, you only walk half a block. Perfect for street tourism makes, everything is within walking distance: The famous Startups, theater, museums, also stops for the metro and tram stops.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised.
review.reviewText:
We landed at SFO airport and decided to try MARTA in to the city based upon the hotel proximity to the CIVIC center.
Once we arrived and came up to street level, the hotel was basically right there. Extremely easy to walk to.
Upon arrival Mark checked us in and was very friendly and helpful and knowledgeable.
Our room was great, very clean and comfortable. Bed was perfect.
Housekeeping staff was responsive to request for extra towels A+.
We discovered great local breakfast spots. With the location right off Market even attempted to figure out the bus routes to see more of the city.
Hard to find hotels in SFO that are air conditioned and this one was, and very thankful that it was as most days were upper 70's.
Honestly went in with hoping that the HOLIDAY INN would be OK for the weekend and was very pleasantly surprised on all levels.

review.title: Not worth the price!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel through expedia as a last minute deal. For the price of almost 200 dollars I was fairly disappointed at the conditions of the hotel. The hotel is near the civic center and has paid parking which is an additional 43 or 47 dollars and is not included with the room. The parking garage has warning signs that they are not responsible for anything that may occur to your vehicle while it's parked and not to leave valuables. The lobby looks fairly nice, but once you walk into one of the rooms they look like they are not very well kept and need some maintenance. I had requested a non smoking room and the first thing I noticed was that the room I got smelled like cigarettes, not only that but the shower drains where not working properly. I switched rooms, but was not fully satisfied with the hotel. As soon as I steped outside there were people asking for money in front of the hotel entrance, not only that but inside the rooms there have warnings signs not to let strangers in your room, valuables left out, and never to open the door even if someone claims they are hotel staff. Which is not horrible, but I didn't feel safe and comfortable staying in that location and going outside. For the price I expected better. I suggest paying a little more and staying elsewhere, especially if you have children with you.

review.title: San Franscisco Giants Stay
review.reviewText: When we arrived around the general area of the hotel, we called to get a more accurate pinpoint of the location. I called the hotel and spoke with DeeDee, a very helpful operator. Had to call twice because there are so many One Way streets that we got turned around. Again, DeeDee was very helpful with directions and we arrived at the hotel garage, got our ticket and drove on through. Had to use the same ticket to get in door. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly staff member at the desk. (sorry I don't remember his name) He informed us that we were booked a handicapped room and asked if we really needed it. I replied that we did not want to be in the room if it was needed. The gentelman at the desk was able to switch us to another room. He did inform us that there was a daily parking fee. We were aware, it was stated on  our itenerary. The room and bathroom was very clean and neat with a TV. There was even a desk. I felt like a VIP. No microwave or small fridge, but we were only staying one night and was no problem for us. I think they would have been available upon request. There was a construction site across the street, but construction didn't start until 7:30am the next morning. No bother for us since we usually wake around 7. When we left the next morning, the cleaning staff was very friendly in asking how the game was and then told us to have a nice day. Check out was quick and we were on our way. Thank you Holiday Inn Staff.

review.title: Great hotel to stay at for concert at Bill Graham
review.reviewText: Great hotel! I stayed at another hotel around the corner (Hotel Whitcomb) during my previous trip to the city, and I can honestly say Holiday Inn Civic Center is MUCH better. The facilities are clean and modern. The Executive Room I booked was clean, updated, had comfortable beds and best of all, a Balcony!! My only complaint was the $42 fee for SELF parking?? Really? The Whitcomb doesn't even charge that much and they actually valet your car. The bartender in the hotel restaurant (a middle aged woman with dirty blonde hair) wasn't very professional. Both times I went into the bar during my stay, she was more interested in talking to the various people in the bar she seemed to know personally. For example, her son and his girlfriend who were sitting at the bar, got great service... I guess maybe you need to share blood with her to get attention. It's a little awkward to stand there for 10+ minutes being ignored while she casually talks about nothing work related with her friends/family. I appreciate that they have a great bond, but maybe save the bonding for after work??

Breakfast buffet was not worth the high price and we did not return after the first morning.  Area is sketchy after dark; we were accosted and blocked on the street by two aggressive guys about 15 yards from the hotel entrance at 830 at night.  No one from the hotel was outside, and I never saw any security guards on the property.

review.title: Good Enough, but far from great.
review.reviewText: Let's start with the good - the people who work there are very, very good. They are obviously under-staffed badly, but the folks who are working are earning every dollar with very hard work. In general, the place is OK, there were no serious problems with anything other than the usual crappy Wifi service you get in all hotels.  But the place, in general, is suffering from what looks like under-investment in general maintenance. Mind you, the place is not dirty and run down, but there are little things. A light bulb out in the lobby area. A stain on the carpet in the hallway. Paint on the pool deck needs to be re-done. In my room, there was a sliding door to a common deck area, it had an additional lock that worked, but was obviously hastily retro-fitted to the door - it looked like they ran down the hardware store and bought some homeowner-grade sliding door locks. The lock worked, but was ugly. It was all the small things like this that gave this place of the staff and management being starved by corporate for the staff they would need to keep the place up properly. Finally, there is a HUGE construction site across the street. You won't over-sleep, because it's LOUD when they start working in the early morning.
review.negativeRemarks: General physical plant upkeep.
review.locationRemarks: It's pretty close to Yerba Buena gardens, the Metreon, the Trollies, The Moscone Center,  shopping and much more.

The employees are great and the facilities are up to par. My only issue was the lack of bottled water. Everytime I go to the sundries, it's closed and the vending machines are either out of order or sold out of water

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Mark will be thrilled to know that you mentioned him. Our staff takes great pride in serving our guests to make their stays as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. It’s nice to hear when we succeed. We hope to welcome you again in the future.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center San Francisco

review.title: Great location in the middle of town.
review.reviewText: Can't really complain.  I can tell you Mark at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant! The facility is locked down like fort Knox due to the homeless population.  The only real complaint is that renting a room in San Francisco costs alot!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for the five star rating!! We are pleased to know that our staff took good care of you when you stayed with us. Our people are our biggest asset so it’s nice to have that recognized. We will make sure that Benny knows that you appreciated his service. We hope to welcome you again when you next visit San Francisco.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center San Francisco

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: This was our first time staying in SF overnight. I was nervous because I am not familiar with the downtown area. Upon entering the hotel I was so happy to see how modern and clean it was. I walked over to the desk and was helped by an amazingly friendly and courteous desk clerk named Benny. I remember his name because he was so nice and gave us great advice on taking MUNI to our other destinations in the city. He took out a map and showed us where we were and how to get to where we wanted to go. I was glad he knew cause I would have been lost and I was happy to find Benny again at checkout. Just as friendly and helpful and he remembered us !! I work in Customer Service and meeting Benny and having him help me, makes me want to be better at my job. I Loved our whole experience at Holiday Inn. I will only stay at this hotel now when I go to the city. It is located right off of Market st and very close to the Freeway on ramp home ;)
review.positiveRemarks: Customer Service I received by Benny and the speedy hot breakfast I was able to order from room service.
review.negativeRemarks: The door area in the parking garage smells like urine. Yes I said Urine! It was the only down side to the whole trip. Maybe power wash it once a week?
review.locationRemarks: Muni and Bart is easily accessible and shopping is within walking distance.

managementResponses.response:

review.negativeRemarks: N/A

Overall a great experience

review.title: Holiday Inn Civic Center - Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel had been recently renovated and was clean, modern, and stylish. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Conveniently located within a block or so of the Market St Street Car and numerous restaurants and shops on Market St. On site parking conveniently located.

Would stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall value and proximity to Market St. Conveniently located.
review.negativeRemarks: On site restaurant a bit pricey, but food was good and conveniently located at the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Market Street, classis Streetcar transportation and the Civic Center. Also a short pleasant walk to Union Plaza and upscale shopping.

review.title: Friendly hotel near central city
review.reviewText:
enjoyed the location of the hotel near the shopping strip of San Francisco and easy access to tram to get to Fisherman's Wharf.
The hotel staff was extremely helpful and were able to move us to another room when requested.
Would stay there again without hesitation.
The hotel is OK but there are to many homeless in the neighborhood. It looks very unsafe and scary at night time.
Only lack of amenity noticed was that there wasn't a fridge in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location and safety features like requiring key card to travel to any floor besides Parking Garage and Lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Fridge in room!
review.locationRemarks: Very, very close to Bill Graham Civic Auditorium for concerts.

review.title: Stayed for location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very convenient to market st theaters. Parking was outrageous $43 but they let us park the car all the next day while we explored the city. Rooms were clean and large. No pool. Building seemed old but I felt room staff did a good job. Area is sketchy but no worse than anywhere else in civic / tenderloin area. Staff was accommodating to our large family. Lots of locks on doors elevators parking garage. Thin walls on rooms. The give you ear plugs for a reason. I would stay there again unless I could find another with cheaper or free parking

review.title: Nice hotel for the price during the realtors expo
review.reviewText: At arrival the front desk gave us a small handicap room. Stated they were overbooked and that expedia doesnt guranteed the room we booked thru them. Fortunatly I was able complaint to executive services and within the hour they was able to upgrade us to a king size bed suite. Which was only fair considering I was staying for 5 days. Very pleased about how everything turned out. If you don't mind seeing homeless people outside then its a good place to stay in SF. Other than the hiccup at checking the staff was amazing. Updated room. Very clean. Comfy bed. Very quiet.

review.title: Everything is broken!
review.reviewText: I switched rooms twice because of a broken sliding door and then a room that smelled like smoke. I would have switched a third time because the thermostat was broken but at that point I just didn't care and the room was warm enough for me. Terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: facilities needs to keep up on maintaining the hotel

review.title: A decent hotel, could be much better
review.reviewText:
I love staying at this hotel because every room has a balcony and I love the fresh air. Yes it is noisy - the Hotel is located in downtown San Francisco, which they're re-building, so some loud noise is to be expected.
The Staff is friendly and helpful, the pool is clean, the cleaning Ladies try to clean the rooms as best they can - but every room I've stayed in has broken items and show many signs of age, all of which can make a room look dirty.
The rooms are affordable, very basic and minimal - but they all have a balcony and a clean bed.
This could be a 4-star hotel if they put some money into fixing stained or broken items from rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel in a questionable area
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff. Very clean & modern rooms. Parking garage very secure. Location is somewhat seedy, but tolerable.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to public transportation.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Lots of street people in neighbourhood, even one that opened our taxi door upon arrival for a tip.
review.negativeRemarks: Mmm
review.locationRemarks: Close to where you want to be but lots of street people within 2 blocks

review.title: Not bad, not great
review.reviewText: Terrible wi-fi, marginal comfort room, this is a budget hotel. Its clean and overall a bargin.

review.title: Old building. Bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: I never felt secure while in the area around this hotel. Streets are dirty and there are LOTS of homeless people. Hotel pictures in the official website are so nice but they are far away from reality.

review.title: Hotel amongst the homeless.
review.reviewText: This Holiday Inn, near the Civic Center, is surrounded by homeless and street people. This made walking to area attractions very uncomfortable. There was also major construction next to the hotel, just outside our room. For four nights, we were awakened at 6 a.m. by the sound of pile drivers, et al of construction equipment, rousing us from our sound sleep. The also charged me twice for use of their parking facility. I had to call the hotel twice to get a credit. The restaurant was a side show, with servers competing with each other for tables!
review.negativeRemarks: The surrounding area needs to be cleaned up by the city of San Francisco. They laissez-faire attitude towards the street people/homeless is a disgrace
review.locationRemarks: AS per above, we never went out at night, due to the presence of the homeless and street people and other shady characters.

review.title: Not a good experience at checking in
review.reviewText: We had some problem when checking in because my brother book the rooms and paid with his credit card. The front desk would let us check in and gave us the wrong phone number to change the reservation. Just won't let us check in until we resolved the issue and it was getting late at night. I thought the hotel could be a little more helpful and make our check in easier.

review.title: Overpriced motel
review.reviewText: This was more like a roadside motel. Clean enough, but small, old, and uncomfortable. I only stayed here because it was close to the courthouse where I had a work thing. Will find somewhere else next time, especially for the money.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: We had a short visit, we had a concert close by at the Davies Symphany Hall. As soon as we walked in the hotel it was beautiful and modern. We were early and our room wasn't ready so they held out bags while we explored the city. There was a nice farmers market close by with music and food vendors! The Bart and Muni system was close so everything was convenient to get to. We bought the three day muni pass which was great! When we finally got back from exploring the city we were exhausted...so happy to go into our room that was clean and beautiful and Hobo free:). The bathrooms were nice, showers pressure awesome. Bath and Body works soap conditioner and lotion. I have no idea why this hotel doesn't coat more than it does! The area is not the best, but the homeless don't mess with you much. I think they are all over San Francisco anyway? We felt really safe and had a really nice stay!
review.negativeRemarks: I think what would make it over the top is a hot tub:)
review.locationRemarks: Really great market area. Starbucks and other coffee places close by. Awesome diner close by that was called Sams Diner (so yummy).

review.title: Last minute trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I really liked how everything from entering the hotel through the garage to the elevator to using the bathroom required the hotel key card. It made me feel really safe.
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked the comfy bed

review.title: Good.
review.reviewText: We stayed over night to attend SFGiants game. Staff helpful, local transportation to/from game, eat/drink nearby, parking available for fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep upgrading, overall hotel is good. Keep the place clean.
review.locationRemarks: A lot!

review.title: Nice hotel closer to everything
review.reviewText: I have used Expedia to look for my hotel in my budget and I was surprised that it gave me a nice one. We checked in late but the staff are great. The parking in the hotel is not that great but I know that its safe. The outside of the hotel is not as classy as I expected but they are harmless. Burger King and Subway is just around the corner and the transportation going to the wharf is accessible. We have a great time and the rooms are spacious except the bathroom that is quite small for the 4 of us. I will definitely go there again when I visit San Francisco again.

review.title: noisy
review.reviewText: there is a reason why there are complimentary ear plugs in the room, the hotel is very noisy and not in a very good area, there is creepy people hanging around the street corners. the hotel is nice and the breakfast was also good however if you have been traveling and you are very tired Not the hotel for you
review.negativeRemarks: the area and noise that comes into the room in the middle of the night
review.locationRemarks: nothing

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText:
I booked a room here for 2 nights, but honestly, had I not prepaid I would have left after the first. The one redeeming quality was the guy at checkout (wish I could remember his name)- actually all the hotel staff that I interacted with was great. Except the restaurant which was terrible, but I'll get to that later. The walk from the BART to the hotel was scary... bums everywhere so try not to do the walk by yourself at night. Once inside the hotel you feel safe though, they have valets posted at the doors seemingly in part to keep the derelicts out and you have to have a key to access the floors the rooms are on. The room itself looked ok at first but walking barefoot I kept getting the bottoms of my feet sticky from something on the carpet that I could not identify.
The worst thing about the hotel is the restaurant staff. Personally, I worked at a Holiday Inn bar/restaurant for a number of years, so I know how hard their job can be and I am usually sympathetic to that. But this one was awful. We walked in and the woman behind the menu stand was sitting stacking menus or something. She didnt even acknowledge us so we thought the restaurant was closing and headed into the bar section. Once in there we're told they dont serve food and to go to the restaurant where the host finally seated us. We then waited for about 15 minutes for our server to come by. I would have left to find food elsewhere but was scared of the bums. It went downhill from there. Food sucked
review.negativeRemarks: Service training in the restaurant. Get people who actually care about their job and want to do it right.

review.title: Nice hotel close to public transportation
review.reviewText: Stayed there and went to the San Francisco giants game. Parked at the hotel and took public transportation to the game, which was a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Very convenient in a city where parking is impossible. Staff was very nice and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was extremely nice and very helpful.

review.title: Not in a great location
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel itself was fine, no complaints around the cleanliness and facilities, most of the staff were friendly and helpful however 1 or 2 were not. Also, it's not in the best location, just a couple of blocks from the Tenderloin it's a bit dodgy although we didn't have any problems. It's not very close to any attractions either.

review.title: The Hotel is just OK. Its in a sketchy area
review.reviewText:
The hotel is just OK but a big negative is that its in a sketchy part of town. I think that is a definitely drawback. I am from Los Angeles so I am not scared easily but I would have rather stayed elsewhere if I knew what the situation around there is.

Like all of SF (Parking is Ridicoulous) it was $47 a day. Yup! Crazy huh? I parked the car next door at the neighboring hotel for a deal $35 hahaha. The place is as expected and the rooms are ok if you just plan to sleep and rest for a bit. There is current construction next to the Hotel and staff give you 99cent quality ear plugs. lol. Luckily I went there for the SF Marathon and well construction was halted for the weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the staff need like they need some coffee. A bit too grumpy but I know they have a tough job
review.locationRemarks: Down the street is Folsom Street. Good bars but like I said really sketchy part of town.

review.title: Great Staff, Location and Room
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is great. The staff is friendly, the rooms are super clean, the sound proof between rooms is perfect and there is free Wi-Fi. I wish all hotels were like this Holiday Inn.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds have two types of pillows, firm and soft, LOVE IT!
review.locationRemarks: Close to CBD and Mission Bay

review.title: Chillin at the Holiday Inn Civic Center
review.reviewText: Although the hotel was surrounded my construction sites (nothing was happening, the construction sites looked abandoned, just an eye sore), the hotel was a gem. Right next to Market Street and all the bus lines to take you either to Union Square, Mission District, Marina, Ferry Building, etc. We were able to check in three hours before check in time, and we were able to secure a two double bed room, perfect for the four of us! We were originally down for a king sized single room. The door attendant was friendly and the other staff were very accommodating. We had no trouble at all at this hotel. We were chillin at the Holiday Inn.

review.title: Not relaxing
review.reviewText: Loud location, crap water pressure, had to go to another floor for ice
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to sleep

review.title: Good if you need to stay at the area
review.reviewText: The Hotel is close to the BART and is very easy to get from the airport using public transportation. The hotel lobby is very nice, the rooms are OK, the staff was very helpful. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, the food was bellow standard, expensive and the staff was extremely slow.
review.negativeRemarks: The food at the restaurant downstairs

review.title: Matches the price
review.reviewText: I called in once for blankets and never got them. An hour later I did call back and they were brought up within ten minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough blankets and poor service
review.locationRemarks: Kind of in the hood.

review.title: Was good for 4 FOR OUR FAMILY.
review.reviewText: Good hotel and very central... Parking cost as much as the room though, but that's standard for SF.
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING COST
review.locationRemarks: CENTRAL BAY AREA

review.title: Exactly What a Hotel Should Be
review.reviewText:
I stay in San Francisco for one week, every month for business and have been doing so for over a year. That means I have tried many of the hotels further inside the financial district. My work pays for my stay and used to book the rooms for me at "nicer" much more expensive places. But I don't like luxury hotels for a variety of reasons (don't like the tiny fees tacked onto everything, and don't like the attitude most of the time), so I have started booking my own rooms.

My stay at the Civic Center Holiday Inn was a huge, eye-opening treat! It reminded me of all the hotels I stayed in as a kid. It's true the area is unsavory, but you have to know that going in. If you're okay with that part, the staff are VERY professional, the rooms are clean, the WiFi is free, and everything is "just right." Even on weekend nights, my room was quiet.

I had a problem with my key one day, and the desk listened well to my issue, despite being busy, and sent an engineer to help me right away. I was impressed with every aspect of my stay, and recommend this place to anybody sick of the B.S. that the more swanky local places put you through for twice the cost. Let's get back to "real" hotels. This is only a couple extra blocks away from the business district, and face it -- you need the walk. Holiday Inn feels great.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean Quiet Room, Good Smart Service, Courteous Maids, Free WiFi, No Hidden Fees
review.negativeRemarks: Soaps and Shampoos are bad. Buy your own.
review.locationRemarks: It's on the edge of the Tenderloin. You need to be prepared for what that means. Don't be a wuss.

review.title: Fantastic value for money in a central location
review.reviewText: Hotel is very centrally located in downtown SF and close to all transport links

review.title: so-so accommodations for business trip
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and nice lobby, but room seemed a little old and grungy. Plus the area around the hotel was not great.

review.title: Awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel, located approximately a half block from BART, doesn't look like much on the outside, but on the inside,wow! I arrived prior to the check-in time and had no problem getting into my room early. EVERYONE was courteous and were happy to help with anything I needed. My room was spotless and very comfortable and I would have loved to have stayed longer! I will definitely stay here on my next trip to SFO!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location; not far from Market Street, the Civic Center, museums, and Powell Street. Only half a block from BART.

review.title: Great Overnighter
review.reviewText: Excellent and responsive staff from check in to check out. Upgraded room to higher floor due to Priority Club member status. Noisy A/C unit when fan is on but provide appropriate cooling and ventilation. Housekeeping staff noisy in morning around 8am in halls along with other room doors closing noisily. Room very streamline to point of stark based on perspective. Overall good stay and centrally located to Opera house and Symphony Hall.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to fine arts district but a bit dicey around perimeter of hotel

review.title: Good central location with great service.
review.reviewText:
I'm a regular annual visitor to SF, and normally stay at The Whitcomb around the corner on Market St.

Got a better rate at the Holiday Inn this year, and since know the area around the hotel reasonably well, and have stayed at Holiday Inn's around the world, decided to give the hotel a go.

Overall really impressed with the Holiday Inn - although it lacks the character of the Whitcomb, it has modern decor in the communal areas, is clean and my room had been recently renovated.

I'm a very independent traveller, so I didn't use any of the on site services - like the restaurant, or bar, or business centre.

The positives:
1) Room size was good.
2) Service within the hotel was good, in fact room cleaning was sometimes a little too eager to clean my room early in the morning!
3) Hotel location is great for public transport connection. There are BART and Muni stations at Civic Center, as well as bus stops - ideal if you want an easy and cheap transfer from SFO and the ability to get around town easily.

The negatives:
1) Some people may find the homeless that congregate in the Civic Center area intimidating. I've never found them to be troubling, but I'm used to an urban area.
2) Civic Center area is a bit down at heel, but I've never felt unsafe at any time.
3) The hotel seems to cater to large tour parties, so you need to time check in and out to avoid the reception area at peak times.

Overall impressed, and very happy with my stay, and I'll definitely be booking again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great room, and convenient, central location.

review.title: Holiday Inn in Need of Comfort Upgrades
review.reviewText: Beds are incredibly hard and rooms are excessively noisy as there are two construction sites in the area: one next door and another one across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Uncomfortable and almost painful bed mattresses
review.locationRemarks: Irvine, CA

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Several maintenance problems (washing machine, internet access)...
Breakfast basic.
Unsafe surroundings.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Not so good location with lots of homeless around...

review.title: good hotel, bad area
review.reviewText:
The hotel was great in all ways.....clean,m comfy, mannerly friendly workers, good food (we ordered two meals to room), good parking.
HOwever, the area was not so good....we walked to Union Square and the Civic Center.
The walk was obviously through a run down part of town.] You could take a taxi as it is not far from those two areas above.
review.negativeRemarks: the area around hotel was not very good.i would lower the price because of the area.
review.locationRemarks: slums, but did not get bothered on our walk to and fro from Union Square. we walked in daylight.

review.title: An OK Hotel in Not-OK neighborhood.
review.reviewText:
Location of the hotel seems to be good as it's close to the city hall, government buildings, and not too far away from the Moscone Center where GDC was being held which was my purpose of visiting San Francisco.

However, the streets surrounding the hotel area is dirty, a lot of 'street people' (meaning homeless... drunks... and gang looking people), heard police, firetruck, ambulance siren more than once or twice in every hour through out the day.

My San Francisco local friends tell me that I should not go out at night as it could get dangerous.

My review of the hotel, hence, is more influenced by the surrounding area.
review.positiveRemarks: Relatively good distance to Moscone hotel (about 4 city blocks away, or 15 min walking distance).
review.negativeRemarks: Area near and surrounding the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: as explained, bad to my liking.

review.title: Solid value in a central location.
review.reviewText:
The Holiday Inn - Civic Center was exactly what I was looking for this trip. Central location, close proximity to public transportation, reasonable rates, and clean, well-maintained facilities. It's not the most attractive from the outside, but the interior remodeling is quite nice.

There are a few quirks in the rooms that reveal that this was an older hotel that has been refurbished (dearth of three-pronged outlets, puzzling heating controls, lack of room fridge, etc.) but none were real problems. Otherwise I was quite satisified, and I especially appreciated the varied pillow types.

There is a bit of grittiness to the surrounding neighborhood, but the attractive SF downtown is only a short ways away via cab, MUNI, or even on foot.

review.title: Very nice, clean, comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and nice. Restaurant was very good. We would definately stay there again. Excellent value for the price. Don't let the outside fool ya. Very nice inside.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location just off Market St.

review.title: Surprisingly Nice Quality and Good Value
review.reviewText:
They upgraded me to the executive floor so I got a remodeled room which was excellent. The lobby area was remodeled and is one of the finest Holiday Inns that I've seen....very elegant, like an upscale hotel.

Unfortunately, like most SF hotels, they charge extra for parking.....never like that. I got back from a meeting several hours after I checked out and my parking had expired. They gave me a pass with very nice courtesy.

Had breakfast in their well-designed restaurant: it was Excellent! Great service, terrific food. Not bargain-priced at all, but I definitely got what I paid for.

This wasn't a cheap place to stay, but reasonably priced for the location and I was pleasantly surprised by almost everything....it exceeded my expectations (except for the cost of parking).
review.negativeRemarks: Having the extra charge for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Not the best part of town....lots of homeless types and characters on the sidewalks.....but then again well-located to walk to lots of useful places.

review.title: Easy access to BART/MUNI
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great option for a cost-conscious business trip. The area wasn't beautiful but you can't ask for better access to the BART and MUNI.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was a good central base for seeing the city,the underground & bus stop was a short walk & the trams 15mins. There are alot of homeless people in the surrounding streets but they did not bother us in anyway
The room was clean & bed comfortable, you could watch movies that are just at the pictures (for a fee)

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in a very good location. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Miriam
review.reviewText:
Luxurious Holiday Inn. No breakfast included.
The location was central.

review.title: An average 3* in a an average area
review.reviewText:
Room was good, parking very expensive, heated pool but no linen, so you have to take your bathtowels to take the elevator on your way back, soaking. and nobody on the phone to get new towels. you have to go at the reception desk to get a response.
the area is 60% professionals, 40% homeless and it's reversed during the night.

review.title: Shame on Holiday Inn
review.reviewText: The Hotel looks to have had a re-paint quite recently including a reception area re-fit. The area of the City is dirty and not what I would consider safe if you have children. I was unfortunate to have a family next to my room who decided to light up a joint or two at 2.00am. The old patio sliding doors are not draught proof at all, so I ended up with the stink of weed filling my room. I called reception to ask that they deal with this and to be fair they did send someone to ask that they reduce the noise as other guests had complained. Well this didn't work so I had to go downstairs to ask the Duty Manager to deal with this or I was calling the Police to have them deal with it. This seemed to work as the noise reduced through the paper thin walls by about 3.00am. Holiday Inn are supposed to have a "Completey Satisfied Commitment" just don't expect the next shift manager to have any knowledge of problems throughout the night, the daytime Manger was oblivious and did not have the courtesy to ask how my stay was. Save yourself some grief and stay where the staff care, Try Best Western, the staff do care. THE HOTEL STAFF ARE VERY POOR AND SHOULD BE RETRAINED IN CUSTOMER RELATIONS.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel and centraly located.

review.title: Nice hotel.....bad area!
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean. Staff was very helpful. We got to San Francisco early and they allowed us to check in way before check in time. Hotel was priced right just dont walk around the neighborhood......even though the neighgorhood was a little rough....I felt very safe in the hotel there was always someone at the door making sure only guest came in.

review.title: Not impressed~!!!
review.reviewText:
wont consider going back again~
i forgot to give one of the room keys back and they charged me~!!!
OMG~ it's free in Vegas~!!!!!
and its not free here~ its just a piece of plastic~!!!

review.title: A nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel is not very attractive from the outside, but the lobby and rooms are well furnished and up to date.

review.title: Clean and Comfy
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable room. Not too far from restaurants in SOMA and grocery stores.

review.title: Convenient location with off street parking
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel on the average of twice a year for over ten years. The property is looking better than it ever has before. The staff is professional in every way.

review.title: Good value for the money,
review.reviewText:
This is a convenient location if you want to explore the city.
Suggest to use car park next door that is much cheaper than hotel parking.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText:
The hotel is situated close to Civic Center and within easy walking distance.
Though not the most pleasant of walks.
Nice diner nearby
Taxis are not easy to find there
Staff helpful

review.title: It's fine for where it is.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was obviously remodeled. Popcorn ceiling and aluminum sliding glass door left over from the 70's mixed with modern furniture, flat screen TV and sheets. I paid extra to stay at the "Executive Levels" (floor 10 and above) because SF downtown is very noisy. Even at the 11th floor, the street noise was too much for sleeping but it's still okay to watch TV. Police siren rang through the night. Good thing I had ear plugs. The neighborhood has a lot of homeless people but they don't really bother you if you just keep walking and mind your own business.

The hotel directory listed the business center on the 4th floor but that room was turned into the soda pop machine room. A small glass-in area with two computers is around the corner from the lobby.

The restaurant charges a lot for breakfast. There are a few options nearby that you can pay half of that restaurant menu. Wifi is really slow although it's free.

It's fairly clean and the cleaning crew got very excited after picking up a tip from my husband. It's just half a block from a BART station and a few blocks from where my conference was. The location worked well for the purpose of my trip.

review.title: I love my stay over there.
review.reviewText: The location is good. The front desk staff members are friendly. The room is clean. Everything is good.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The clerk at the desk when I checked in was very nice. However, the fellow who was asked to let me have a baggage cart (both at arrival and departure) was rude. The 2nd night, the key-card did not work in my door; it took 45 minutes to try to fix it. Finally, they had to code another card so that I could get into my room. The 3rd night, 3 of the elevators were "stuck" on various floors, and the maintenance person in the elevator area had no idea why, and couldn't actually say whether or not the remaining elevator could/would get stuck as well. The shower curtains in the bathroom did not seem to be able to keep a large amount of water from getting onto the bathroom floor, even tho I put the curtains inside the bathtub. And the parking rates are horrendous. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The room's window are too old and require maintenance, sound and cold go through. Cleanliness is good but staff at the front desk are not service oriented.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: Close to theatre and reasonably priced restaurants. Hotel bar closes too early on weekends. Neighborhood dicey but doable, be aware of your surroundings. Free wifi in rooms.

review.title: Nicest Holiday Inn I've Stayed/Visited
review.reviewText:
The hotel lobby has a very clean/modern look. The room was nice and the beds were comfy. You also had pillow choices - firm or soft.

The only problem we had was the cleanliness of the shower/tub. Under the rubber mat was filthy, as if no one had bothered to clean underneath it in months. My roommate and I were uncomfortable taking a shower.

Despite the nasty shower, I'd probably stay here again. I guess for me, the comfortable beds outweighed the filth in the shower.

review.title: victoria travel to san franisco California
review.reviewText: I had always traveled in holiday inn but fact that my room was not ready really up set me, they gave a king and rollaway bed.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: San Francisco: a wonderful city worth coming back an endless number of times

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: As long as you don't mind a somewhat rundown neighborhood, this hotel was a good value. Clean and well maintained, the hotel had a great staff and comfortable rooms. The location was convenient if you are interested in the government buildings and the public library. It was also close to the several public transportation options and close to the Orpheum theater. We walked from the hotel to the theater and back without any hesitation. If you have ever been to New York City and approached the theater district from the port authority, you'll have some sense of what the neighborhood is like.

review.title: Great location for San Fran Pride
review.reviewText: The parking situation sucks, but that is San Fran for you! Other than that it was great. When the Parking got full the Managewr gave his spot up and made room for cars. Great Service!

review.title: Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel room was very clean. Comfortable bed with comfortable pillows. Great price for a good hotel. Front desk employees were nice and friendly. Free wi-Fy was great. Nice lobby.

review.title: A Nice Surprise!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it was close to relatives I was visiting. I was surprised by the quality of the hotel. The pool was awesome, the staff was friendly and helpful and the location couldn't be beat. Parking was secure and not a bad price for the area. Will definitely return. I got way more than I expected for the price.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent service...
review.reviewText:
This hotel is literally around the corner from the train station, and only a 20 minute train journey from the international airport. It is also on the doorstep of Market St, which has lots of places to eat, and is a short streetcar ride away from the coast.

The staff at the check-in desk were extremely helpful, and took the time to help us book our Alcatraz tour (which I would highly recommend). The room was well-sized and comfy, and all staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Extremely good value for money and unbeatable location - would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great location! Loved every minute of it!
review.reviewText: Had a great time!

review.title: Pleasant hotel, not sure of the surroundings.
review.reviewText: Hotel was located in an area where some of the buildings were not as pristine as they could be but the facilities were adequate. Parking is available at extra cost but is on the premises and convenient. Pity breakfast is not included in the price. Overall, location is centrally convenient and hotel provides reasonable value for money.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It is a very clean hotel, room was very nice. However, be careful if you are gong back to hotel on foot after midnight.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel neighborhood was iffy. But parking was GREAT for San Francisco. Room key allowed access into and out of parking structure with any restrictions. Hotel was close to everywhere we wanted to go. Room seemed to be recently redecorated, was very comfortable and spacious.

review.title: Had a great time!!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay very much. The hotel was nicely decorated. The employees, especially the front door/ bellhops were very helpful and accomodating. I would definitely go back. I did not enjoy paying extra for parking, I am not used to the costs associated with big cities. Overall would reccomend this hotel.

review.title: HI
review.reviewText: Expecially appreciated the 12 noon check out time.

review.title: Tried and True
review.reviewText: Hard to find a nice central hotel close to the bart and the company shuttle. This happens to fit the bill perfectly. Good strong and free wifi.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText:
Why stay at the Marriott and pay 3x as much!
Great renovation. Rooms are moderate but immaculate.
Lobby very attractive. Good on-site restaurant & bar.

review.title: Good Hotel, but homeless around
review.reviewText: Good quality and service, 10min from Union Square, BUT the homeless around always are messing with you (not advisable for people w/children).

review.title: Cute Renovated Hotel, Bad Service.
review.reviewText: This hotel has recently been updated, and the lobby is very nice-looking. Our room had been partially updated - new linens and furniture, but bathtub definitely needed work as grout was cracking and kind of scary-looking, to be honest. Walls are thin - sounded like our neighbors were in the same room. Ear plugs were necessary. Front desk service was, unfortunately, not so good: we asked for a cab to a local restaurant (some of us were in 4-inch heels) and the man who took our call actually said "are you kidding me? It's three blocks away." He never called the cab. We hailed one from Market St, the nearest cross-street. Guys, I don't care how close the location is. If your guest asks for a cab, get them one, or explain how to best get one. Pretend your guest has never been in the city before, and be helpful. I've stayed in worse places in the city. But I've also stayed in better.

review.title: SF 4* star hotel at 3* price
review.reviewText: Recently renovated so the room and the hallway looked new. Room is quite spacious, with a balcony. There is minor construction going on, with occasions of hammering and one elevator was still covered with cardboard. It was comfortable and relaxing environment. 5 minutes walk to Bart and Muni, closer than most downtown hotels. As for homeless, they are no threat and we felt safe. Convenient to go to theaters and little Saigon for meals.

review.title: Was satisfactory
review.reviewText: The hotel was performing some renovation work, therefore the first floor was not very beautiful. Otherwise, the rest of the hotel was very nice, the personnel was helpful, my room was clean and bright. The hotel was close to where I had to be on my trip to SF, and the price was not high. Overall, it was a satisfactory stay.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is under construction and it didn't effect the quality at all. The rooms were nice, comfortable and very clean. The staff were friendly. The room air conditioner/heater turned on/off a lot at night. We just kept the outside air on while sleeping and it acted like a white noise.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: Stayed there for a convention at the Moscone Center. For the price and convenience (I walked to the show), its worth it. Though they were a little understaffed during checkin / out.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was helpful and courteous and the rooms were very comfortable and clean. However, the area that this hotel is in is not the best. I did not always feel safe walking out of the hotel alone. Also, I was charged $49 for 3 movies that were ordered by the previous occupants of our room the night BEFORE we even checked in!! And, although I was told last week that the amount would be credited, I am still waiting for them to refund me for this mistake.

review.title: Very good value
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little bit far from Moscone Center, but the rooms were clean, the cleaning staff was very efficient and nice, and the free breakfast was filling and tasty. A great value, and a good hotel for a biz trip.

review.title: exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to SF. We were somewhat apprehensive to stay at this hotel for 7 days given the reviews and rating of 3.2. However, even though the hotel is currently undergoing extensive renovations our stay was fantastic and we would not hesitate to stay there again. - centrally located for walking everywhere or transit at the door - great service and breakfast - friendly and responsive staff - overall great value -

review.title: Central location with access to Mission nightlife and Union Square shopping
review.reviewText: Staying there again next month. Clean pool, good continental breakfast, room was comfortable. Being renovated so look forward to improvements.

review.title: Hotel being refurbished
review.reviewText: Hotel is being refurbished with a lot of construction activity. Beware of the expensive daily parking rate!!

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: the only drawback was a housekeeping supervisor who kind of got in my face about the fact that I didn't allow housekeeping into my room and would just go into the hall when housekeeping was on my floor to drop off my used sheets and towels in exchange for fresh. what business was it of hers? I always tip the person who ends up coming in when I check out very very well so I'm sure it's much more of a boon than a bother. that really irked me.

review.title: Location, Location, Location--and that's all.
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Civic Center is San Francisco's worst bargain. The registration desk is inadequately staffed and the lines spill out into the lobby. It got so bad that you couldn't get from the elevators to the door without weaving through a mob. They promise free newspapers (in fact, they make you sign for them when you check in) but they don't deliver unless you repeatedly ask. They have a "temporary" kiosk for booking trips that will only accept cash--no credit cards. The hotel is under construction so there was no restaurant; no lounge. Only breakfast was available in the ballroom. They used an entire floor to interview prospective police officers for the SFPD. The interviewees waited around in the undersized lobby making access to the door even more difficult. The swimming pool was closed and guests who wanted to swim were directed to the local YMCA. All in all, a big disappointment.

review.title: expected it to be better
review.reviewText: holiday Inn should have better standard than this. very low supply on soaps etc , very noisy elevaters which causes disturbance in night,gift shop personal very rude , all in all they should try to improve the quality

review.title: Very nice place to rest your head.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean, it's employees very helpful and pleasant. My room, espcially, was quite clean. It's furniture and carpeting looked almost new. I would happily stay there again.

review.title: good price
review.reviewText: the hotel was a great price in the area and its within walking of downtown and close to subway.

review.title: Bad neighborhood.  Dirty Shower
review.reviewText: Not a nice neighborhood.  Shower was very dirty. I would not stay at this hotel again.
